freetext.name: Section 1
freetext.p: Did you ever think: "mmm... all this J2EE stuff is too complex! There must be an easier way to program?" Read the good news: AndroMDA is here to help you! Generating J2EE components quickly and reliably from models drawn in the graphical Unified Modeling Language is the main feature of AndroMDA.

AndroMDA (pronounced: andromeda) is an open source code generation framework that follows the model driven architecture (MDA) paradigm. It takes a UML model from a CASE-tool and generates classes and deployable components (J2EE or other), specific for your application architecture.

Read more about AndroMDA, using the links on the left side menu. If you start using AndroMDA, we invite you to subscribe to the project's mailing lists. Another interesting place to watch is the Code Generation Network site where you can read an interview with Matthias Bohlen, the lead engineer behind AndroMDA.

news.name: Wikiweb is online
news.p: Our brand-new Wikiweb is on-line! Share your ideas with other AndroMDA users, see what the developers have on their TODO-list and much more... The Wikiweb is easy to use. Register as a user and join the community!

news.name: Partnering with NoMagic, Inc.
news.p: We have chosen MagicDraw UML to use on our development and support it with AndroMDA for our user community. MagicDraw has won several prizes in the Java developer community. We found that it features a very good performance and is stable and mature. Recommended!

news.name: AndroMDA as a Poseidon plug-in
news.p: AndroMDA now runs as a plug-in with Poseidon, Gentleware's widely known CASE tool. You will see that code generation runs much faster than in stand-alone mode because AndroMDA can now access the model directly in Poseidon's memory.
